page.title: 15A Country Walk
page.content: We went for a walk to{Laindon {Common}, some mums drove us in their cars to get to the start. It was the wettest June for fourteen years so we had to wear wellington boots and waterproof anoraks, but some of us forgot. The lane was very wet and slippery, with huge puddles because the surface is still only hard earth. There are still ledges alongside the lane the plants we saw were various grasses, buttercups, stinging nettles, dog roses, burnet roses, goosegrass, greater willow herb, bracken, hogweed, elderberry, blackberry bushes, small field maples, hawthorn and quite large oak trees. One field was growing wheat which had a few wild poppies in, and another barley. Rape is also grown in this area, and these three are the main crops.
